intro: Cedrela febrifuga var. verrucosa, commonly known as the rough-surfaced cedrela, is a tropical tree species belonging to the family Meliaceae. It is characterized by its dark, aromatic wood and distinctive, rough-textured bark. The plant typically grows in lowland tropical forests and is native to regions in Central and South America. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a serrated margin. The flowers are small and clustered, and the fruit is a woody capsule containing several seeds.
